UI.Title: <color=#28ffa6>CHAOS INDUSTRIES (TM) RustNET BASELINK PROTOCOL v{0}</color>
UI.Help.Title: > <color=#28ffa6>Terminal Help Menu</color> <
UI.Help:
> Some notes on terminals

> You can only place 1 terminal per building.
> Terminals can only be placed on building blocks.
> Terminals are linked to the block they are on, if the block is destroyed so is the terminal.
> If at any stage your terminal is destroyed all remote links will be severed and will need to be reset to a new terminal.
> To access a terminal you need to be authorized on the base tool cupboard

> Creating a terminal
Step 1. Acquire a targeting computer.
Step 2. Place the targeting computer in your hands.
Step 3. Type <color=#28ffa6>/terminal add</color>. The terminal placement tool is now activated! You can now place the terminal in your base by pressing the <color=#28ffa6>FIRE</color> button, or cancel placement by pressing the <color=#28ffa6>AIM</color> button.

> Removing a terminal
Step 1. Look at the terminal you want to remove.
Step 2. Type <color=#28ffa6>/terminal remove</color> to remove the terminal (This will remove all remote links to the terminal)
UI.Help.Public:
> Creating a public terminal
These terminals can be placed anywhere and accessed by anyone, although they should NOT be placed on building blocks or player bases.
Step 1. Place the targeting computer in your hands.
Step 2. Type <color=#28ffa6>/terminal add public</color>. You can now place the terminal anywhere by pressing the <color=#28ffa6>FIRE</color> button, or cancel placement by pressing the <color=#28ffa6>AIM</color> button.
